channel.title: Poisoning arrows
channel.description: I can't find a tut anywhere for poisoning arrows (addy arrows p++). help someone?

item.title: Poisoning arrows
item.dc:creator: @Lanepker Lanepker
item.description:
@Lanepker wrote:

[quote=“Roar337, post:4, topic:540213”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=659068.msg4408115#msg4408115 date=1392664923]

learn java and write your own code or hire a developer on a more helpful note go to item on item and make it so when poision and arrows are used together both get deleted and it adds the poison arrow to inventory
[/quote]Very helpful!

If you don’t show him the first time how will they ever learn in the first place, calm down, this is a “Server Help” area right?

OP use the item on item packet to create poisoned arrows as stated above, a mock-up of the interaction will look as follows,

if (itemId1 == ARROW && itemId2 == POISON) { player.getInventory().delete(itemId1); player.getInventory().delete(itemId2); player.getInventory().add(RESULTANT_POISON_ARROW);

Now for applying poison, you’ll need to handle poison ticks within combat, perhaps create a stopwatch on a poisoned player to tick for 10 seconds, at a rate of 1 second each? Then apply a random number depending on the type of poison used.

was trying not to spoon feed another noob who is gonna come back a billion times and never learn anything[/quote]

Afterall this is a “Server Help” area isn’t it? How can he learn if he isn’t showed how to do it in the first place.

Read full topic

item.title: Poisoning arrows

item.description:
@Roar337 wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:3, topic:540213”][quote author=Roar337 link=topic=659068.msg4408041#msg4408041 date=1392639709]
learn java and write your own code or hire a developer on a more helpful note go to item on item and make it so when poision and arrows are used together both get deleted and it adds the poison arrow to inventory
[/quote]Very helpful!

OP use the item on item packet to create poisoned arrows as stated above, a mock-up of the interaction will look as follows,

if (itemId1 == ARROW && itemId2 == POISON) { player.getInventory().delete(itemId1); player.getInventory().delete(itemId2); player.getInventory().add(RESULTANT_POISON_ARROW);

Now for applying poison, you’ll need to handle poison ticks within combat, perhaps create a stopwatch on a poisoned player to tick for 10 seconds, at a rate of 1 second each? Then apply a random number depending on the type of poison used.[/quote]

was trying not to spoon feed another noob who is gonna come back a billion times and never learn anything

Read full topic

@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Roar337, post:2, topic:540213”]learn java and write your own code or hire a developer on a more helpful note go to item on item and make it so when poision and arrows are used together both get deleted and it adds the poison arrow to inventory[/quote]Very helpful!

OP use the item on item packet to create poisoned arrows as stated above, a mock-up of the interaction will look as follows,

if (itemId1 == ARROW && itemId2 == POISON) { player.getInventory().delete(itemId1); player.getInventory().delete(itemId2); player.getInventory().add(RESULTANT_POISON_ARROW);

Now for applying poison, you’ll need to handle poison ticks within combat, perhaps create a stopwatch on a poisoned player to tick for 10 seconds, at a rate of 1 second each? Then apply a random number depending on the type of poison used.
